scripts.compile: mkdir -p lib && npm run copyJSON && npm run compile:xsd && npm run compile:es5
scripts.compile:es5: tsc --project tsconfig.json && echo ok || echo not ok
scripts.copyJSON: cp src/*.json lib/ && echo ok || echo not ok
scripts.test: echo "TODO: These tests are only making sure the converter doesn't throw any errors, but it would be better to compare the actual outputs against validated expected outputs." && npm-run-all test:*
scripts.test:multiple: for f in ./test/input/*.gpml{,.xml}; do echo "Testing converter against $f" && WPID=`echo "$f" | sed "s/.*_WP/WP/" | sed "s/_.*.gpml//"`; cat "$f" | bin/gpml2pvjson --id "http://identifiers.org/wikipathways/"$WPID | jq . > /dev/null; done
scripts.test:chunked: curl --limit-rate 10K "http://webservice.wikipathways.org/getPathwayAs?fileType=xml&pwId=WP554&revision=77712&format=xml" | xpath "*/ns1:data/text()" | base64 --decode | bin/gpml2pvjson --id http://identifiers.org/wikipathways/WP554 | jq . > /dev/null
scripts.test-against-pvjs-gpml-samples: echo "TODO: Break out these GPML files as a test suite with its own repo. Then make that a dependency for both pvjs and gpml2pvjson-js." && for f in ../pvjs/test/input-data/**/*.gpml{,.xml}; do echo "Testing converter against $f" && WPID=`echo "$f" | sed "s/.*_WP/WP/" | sed "s/_.*.gpml//"`; cat "$f" | bin/gpml2pvjson --id "http://identifiers.org/wikipathways/"$WPID | jq . > /dev/null; done
